studyAmendmentImpacts.description: Added benefit-risk assessment specifically for Sweden.
Expanded age range for Cohort 1 and added clinical assessment flexibility.
Increased sample size and added European investigator sites.

studyAmendmentReasons.reasonText: Required for Sweden by the Swedish Medical Products Agency (MPA)
Improve clarity and correct typographic errors
Incorporation of revisions requested by country health authorities and IRBs/ECs

studyChanges.afterText: Benefit-risk assessment (country specific-amendment, required for Sweden)
studyChanges.summary: Added benefit-risk assessment for Swedish MPA compliance.

studyChanges.afterText: Cohort 1 age range to include subjects 65 years of age and older

studyChanges.beforeText: Temperature ranges with gaps and Fahrenheit units
studyChanges.afterText: Removed Fahrenheit and adjusted temperature ranges to close gaps
studyChanges.summary: Standardized temperature reporting and removed gaps in data ranges.

studyChanges.afterText: Instruction for the investigator to contact the sponsor or designee for SAEs occurring within 30 days after vaccination
studyChanges.summary: Added specific reporting instructions for SAEs.

studyChanges.afterText: Immunogenicity bridging analysis will be performed between each of Cohort 2 and Cohort 3 and the subset of subjects 60 through 64 years of age in Cohort 1
studyChanges.summary: Clarified the specific age subset for immunogenicity bridging.

studyChanges.afterText: Physical examination based on medical history
studyChanges.summary: Revised scope of clinical assessment to allow for history-based exams.
